TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDictionaryService

Docs.summary: Provides a basic, component site-specific, key-value pair dictionary through a service that a designer can use to store user-defined data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This service provides a simple interface to set, retrieve, and look up objects with associated keys.
## Examples The following example control and designer use the IDictionaryService to share data through its site-specific key-value pair dictionary.
[!code-cs[IDictionaryServiceExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._17_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[IDictionaryServiceExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.componentmodel._17_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[IDictionaryServiceExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._17_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetKey(object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The value to look up in the dictionary.
Docs.summary: Gets the key corresponding to the specified value.
Docs.returns: The associated key, or if no key exists.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetValue(object key) cil managed

Docs.param: The key to look up the value for.
Docs.summary: Gets the value corresponding to the specified key.
Docs.returns: The associated value, or if no value exists.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValue (object key, object value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValue(object key, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An object to use as the key to associate the value with.
